page.title: 10LAW & ORDER BURSLEM POLICE.
page.content: A party from school visited Burslem police station,built in 1936.A police constable took us on a tour of all the rooms.In the control room,where the walkie-talkies were kept,information was taken and given out.We were then shown the locker room where the uniforms were kept,the finger-print roowhere prisoners where also photographed,the parade-room and the cells.There were three cells which had in each,a mattress and a toilet.Outside there was a small exercise yard for prisoners.The tour ended with a visit to the C.I.D.room,recreation room and cafeteria.The divisional headquarters is at Hanley.This station is a sub- division with 86 people working there.
